section.title: encrypt=[Tagged-Binary]
section.t: The encrypt attribute is used to state that the message body is encrypted using the algorithm and initialization vector specified in the encrypt attribute and the key associated with the specified credential.
The intended use for the encrypt attribute is in cases where an encryption-with-integrity (EWI) algorithm is used though it MAY be used with encryption only algorithms.
If the encrypt attribute is specified, the scope attributes other than the method attribute are ignored and only the presence or absence of the method attribute is noted, the value is ignored.
If the method attribute is present, the encrypted data contains a Request line

All parts of the scope are optional. A HTTP message may have multiple Integrity headers authenticating different parts of the message under the same key.
If no scope attributes are specified, the scope is the HTTP body data alone. Otherwise the body is only part of the scope if the body attribute is specified explicitly.
